• Ensure all servers required by a particular group are members of the same VLAN

• Disable unused ports
  • Put unused ports in an unused VLAN
  • Stop unauthorized access by not granting connectivity or by placing a device into an unused VLAN

• By default, the management VLAN and the native VLAN are VLAN 1
  • Do not use VLAN 1 for in-band management traffic
  • Select a different, dedicated VLAN to keep management traffic separate from user data and protocol traffic

• Standardize the VLAN configuration across the enterprise
  • Provide for easy VLAN management and maintenance
  • Reduce the time required for VLAN administration and maintenance

• Minimizes misconfiguration
  • Propogates and synchronizes VLAN information across member switches
  • Provides extra security when combined with a VTP password

• Ensure that any new switch added to the network has a revision number of zero
• Reset the revision number by either of the following:
1. Set the new switch to transparent mode then switch it back to client or server.
2. Change the domain name to something else. Change it back.
